Instrument.name: The Impactor Targeting Sensor (ITS) for Deep Impact
Instrument.description: The Impactor Targeting Sensor (ITS) was designed to navigate the Deep Impact Impactor spacecraft to the comet. The ITS was mounted inside the impactor with its boresight aligned with the velocity vector. It looked through a rectangular hole cut out on the edge of the copper cratering mass. The ITS was a duplicate of the Medium Resolution Imager (MRI) on the Deep Impact flyby spacecraft (i.e., a 12.0 cm f/3.75 Cassegrain telescope with a CCD detector), but did not have a filter wheel.
